it.apice.sapere.node.agents
Class AbstractAccessPolicy

java.lang.Object
  it.apice.sapere.node.agents.AbstractAccessPolicy
All Implemented Interfaces:
LSAspace, OntologyHandler, LSAspaceAccessPolicy
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultAccessPolicy
public abstract class AbstractAccessPolicy
extends Object
implements LSAspaceAccessPolicy

This class is conceived in order to analyze the requests that an agent forwards and filter out those whose are not legal according to some SAPEREmodel constraint.

Author:
Paolo Contessi

checkInjectPermissions

public abstract void checkInjectPermissions(CompiledLSA cLsa,
                                            SAPEREAgent requestor)
                                     throws SAPEREException

Checks if the requestor has the right to execute the INJECT operation.

In order to deny the permission a SAPEREException must be thrown.

Parameters:
cLsa - The involved LSA
requestor - The requestor SAPEREAgent
Throws:
SAPEREException - Operation forbidden

Returns:

update

public final LSAspace update(LSA lsa)
                      throws SAPEREException
Description copied from interface: LSAspace

Updates the LSA in the space, which has the same LSA-id, with values from the provided one.

LSAId lsaId = getLSAId();
LSA lsa = read(lsaId);

LSA modLsa = modifyLSA(lsa);
assert modLsa.getLSAId().equals(lsaId);
s
update(modLsa);
assert modLsa.equals(read(lsaId));

Specified by:
update in interface LSAspace
Parameters:
lsa - The LSA to be removed
Returns:
The LSAspace itself for further operations
Throws:
SAPEREException - The LSA is not in the LSA-space, permission denied

ignore

public final LSAspace ignore(LSAid lsaId,
                             LSAObserver obs)
Description copied from interface: LSAspace

Stop observing the specified LSA.

If obs isn't actually observing the LSA then the request is dropped silently.

Specified by:
ignore in interface LSAspace
Parameters:
lsaId - The id of the LSA to ignore
obs - The entity that is observing the LSA
Returns:
The LSAspace itself for further operations

Description copied from interface: LSAspace

In order to release the lock call done().
